metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25695 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL versions before 13.1, before 12.5, before 11.10, before 10.15, before 9.6.20 and before 9.5.24. An attacker having permission to create non-temporary objects in at least one schema can execute arbitrary SQL functions under the identity of a superuser. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.1 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as ignored in precise. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-08-23').
